national_security_defense.name: Military Readiness / Force Structure
national_security_defense.definition: Orders affecting the organization, size, training, and operational preparedness of U.S. armed forces.

national_security_defense.name: Defense Industrial Base
national_security_defense.definition: Policies supporting domestic manufacturing of military equipment, weapons systems, and defense supplies.

national_security_defense.name: Missile Defense
national_security_defense.definition: Programs and policies for intercepting and defending against ballistic missile threats.

national_security_defense.name: Nuclear Policy
national_security_defense.definition: Orders governing nuclear weapons strategy, arms control, and non-proliferation efforts.

national_security_defense.name: Counterterrorism
national_security_defense.definition: Policies and operations aimed at preventing, disrupting, and responding to terrorist activities.

national_security_defense.name: Terrorism Designations
national_security_defense.definition: Official designations of groups or individuals as terrorists, triggering sanctions and legal consequences.

national_security_defense.name: Intelligence Operations
national_security_defense.definition: Policies governing intelligence gathering, surveillance, and covert activities by U.S. agencies.

national_security_defense.name: Intelligence Sharing
national_security_defense.definition: Frameworks for sharing intelligence information between agencies and with foreign partners.

national_security_defense.name: Cybersecurity (National Security)
national_security_defense.definition: Protecting government systems and critical infrastructure from cyber attacks and foreign intrusions.

national_security_defense.name: Border Security
national_security_defense.definition: Measures to control and monitor U.S. borders against unauthorized entry and smuggling.

national_security_defense.name: Foreign Terrorist Organizations
national_security_defense.definition: Designations and actions targeting groups identified as international terrorist threats.

national_security_defense.name: Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD) Proliferation
national_security_defense.definition: Efforts to prevent the spread of nuclear, chemical, and biological weapons.

national_security_defense.name: Homeland Security
national_security_defense.definition: Broad domestic security efforts to protect against terrorism and other threats within U.S. territory.

national_security_defense.name: Critical Infrastructure Protection
national_security_defense.definition: Safeguarding essential systems like power grids, communications, and financial networks from attacks.

national_security_defense.name: Combat Zone Designations
national_security_defense.definition: Official designation of geographic areas as active combat zones, affecting military benefits and rules of engagement.

national_security_defense.name: War on Terror
national_security_defense.definition: Broad policies related to the post-9/11 global campaign against terrorism.

national_security_defense.name: National Security Information / Classification
national_security_defense.definition: Rules governing classification, declassification, and handling of sensitive national security information.

national_security_defense.name: Detention Policy / Guantanamo
national_security_defense.definition: Policies regarding detention of enemy combatants and the operation of Guantanamo Bay detention facility.

national_security_defense.name: Electromagnetic Pulse (EMP) Resilience
national_security_defense.definition: Preparations to protect infrastructure from electromagnetic pulse attacks or events.

national_security_defense.name: Defense Production Act
national_security_defense.definition: Invocation of presidential authority to prioritize production of materials for national defense.

national_security_defense.name: Critical Minerals / Supply Chain Security
national_security_defense.definition: Ensuring domestic access to minerals essential for defense and technology manufacturing.

national_security_defense.name: Foreign Election Interference
national_security_defense.definition: Measures to detect, prevent, and respond to foreign attempts to influence U.S. elections.

immigration.name: Border Enforcement
immigration.definition: Policies governing patrol, surveillance, and physical barriers at U.S. borders.

immigration.name: Immigration Enforcement (Interior)
immigration.definition: Enforcement actions within U.S. territory targeting individuals in violation of immigration law.

immigration.name: Legal Immigration Reform
immigration.definition: Changes to lawful pathways for immigration including family-based and employment-based visas.

immigration.name: Visa Policy
immigration.definition: Rules governing the issuance, categories, and requirements for U.S. entry visas.

immigration.name: Refugee Policy
immigration.definition: Policies determining admission numbers, eligibility, and resettlement of refugees.

immigration.name: Asylum Policy
immigration.definition: Rules governing applications for protection by individuals fleeing persecution.

immigration.name: Deportation / Removal
immigration.definition: Policies and priorities for removing individuals from the U.S. for immigration violations.

immigration.name: Citizenship Policy
immigration.definition: Rules affecting naturalization requirements, birthright citizenship, and paths to citizenship.

immigration.name: Family Separation / Reunification
immigration.definition: Policies affecting the detention and separation of families at the border or during enforcement.

immigration.name: Sanctuary City Policy
immigration.definition: Federal policies toward jurisdictions that limit cooperation with immigration enforcement.

immigration.name: Travel Restrictions / Bans
immigration.definition: Restrictions on entry to the U.S. based on nationality or other criteria.

immigration.name: Maritime Interdiction
immigration.definition: Coast Guard and naval operations to intercept migrants at sea before reaching U.S. shores.

economy_trade.name: Trade Policy / Agreements
economy_trade.definition: Policies governing international trade relationships and negotiation of trade deals.

economy_trade.name: Tariffs / Duties
economy_trade.definition: Import taxes imposed on foreign goods to protect domestic industries or as policy leverage.

economy_trade.name: Buy American / Domestic Preference
economy_trade.definition: Requirements for federal procurement to prioritize American-made goods and materials.

economy_trade.name: Manufacturing Policy
economy_trade.definition: Policies to support, incentivize, or restore domestic manufacturing capacity.

economy_trade.name: Supply Chain Security
economy_trade.definition: Efforts to ensure reliable access to critical goods and reduce dependence on foreign suppliers.

economy_trade.name: Economic Sanctions
economy_trade.definition: Financial restrictions and trade prohibitions imposed on foreign countries, entities, or individuals.

economy_trade.name: Financial System Regulation
economy_trade.definition: Rules governing banks, financial markets, and systemic risk management.

economy_trade.name: Cryptocurrency / Digital Assets
economy_trade.definition: Policies addressing digital currencies, blockchain technology, and related financial instruments.

economy_trade.name: Sovereign Wealth Fund
economy_trade.definition: Policies regarding government-owned investment funds for national economic purposes.

economy_trade.name: Tax Policy / Tax Reform
economy_trade.definition: Executive actions affecting tax administration, enforcement, or relief programs.

economy_trade.name: Small Business Support
economy_trade.definition: Programs and policies to assist small businesses with financing, contracting, and regulatory relief.

economy_trade.name: Economic Competitiveness
economy_trade.definition: Broad policies to strengthen U.S. economic position relative to global competitors.

economy_trade.name: Corporate Fraud / White Collar Crime
economy_trade.definition: Enforcement and prevention efforts targeting financial crimes and corporate misconduct.

economy_trade.name: Foreign Investment (CFIUS)
economy_trade.definition: Review and restrictions on foreign investments that may threaten national security.

economy_trade.name: Government Spending / Earmarks
economy_trade.definition: Executive policies affecting federal spending priorities and budget allocation.

economy_trade.name: Financial Literacy
economy_trade.definition: Programs to improve public understanding of personal finance and economic concepts.

economy_trade.name: Antidumping / Trade Enforcement
economy_trade.definition: Actions against foreign goods sold below market value or in violation of trade rules.

economy_trade.name: Economic Recovery (Post-Crisis)
economy_trade.definition: Policies aimed at restoring economic growth following recessions or major disruptions.

economy_trade.name: Opportunity Zones / Distressed Communities
economy_trade.definition: Tax incentives and investment programs targeting economically disadvantaged areas.

economy_trade.name: Housing Policy / Affordable Housing
economy_trade.definition: Policies affecting housing availability, affordability, and federal housing programs.

economy_trade.name: USMCA / Trade Agreement Implementation
economy_trade.definition: Implementation of the U.S.-Mexico-Canada Agreement and related trade commitments.

economy_trade.name: Export-Import Policy
economy_trade.definition: Policies governing the flow of goods in and out of the U.S., including export controls.

economy_trade.name: Seafood / Fisheries Industry
economy_trade.definition: Policies affecting commercial fishing, aquaculture, and seafood trade.

energy_environment.name: Oil and Gas Development
energy_environment.definition: Policies promoting or restricting petroleum and natural gas extraction on federal lands and waters.

energy_environment.name: Coal Industry
energy_environment.definition: Policies affecting coal mining, coal-fired power generation, and coal workers.

energy_environment.name: Renewable Energy
energy_environment.definition: Promotion of solar, wind, hydroelectric, and other clean energy sources.

energy_environment.name: Energy Independence / Security
energy_environment.definition: Policies to reduce reliance on foreign energy sources and ensure domestic supply.

energy_environment.name: Climate Change Policy
energy_environment.definition: Actions addressing greenhouse gas emissions, climate adaptation, and climate science.

energy_environment.name: Paris Agreement / International Climate
energy_environment.definition: U.S. participation in or withdrawal from international climate agreements.

energy_environment.name: Environmental Regulation
energy_environment.definition: Regulatory policies affecting pollution, emissions standards, and environmental compliance.

energy_environment.name: Clean Air / Water
energy_environment.definition: Policies protecting air quality and water resources from contamination.

energy_environment.name: Public Lands Management
energy_environment.definition: Policies governing use, conservation, and development of federally-owned lands.

energy_environment.name: National Monuments / Antiquities
energy_environment.definition: Designation, modification, or revocation of protected areas under the Antiquities Act.

energy_environment.name: Offshore Drilling
energy_environment.definition: Policies governing oil and gas exploration and extraction in federal waters.

energy_environment.name: Pipeline Policy
energy_environment.definition: Approval, permitting, or cancellation of oil and gas pipeline projects.

energy_environment.name: Endangered Species
energy_environment.definition: Policies affecting protection of threatened wildlife and their habitats.

energy_environment.name: Environmental Justice
energy_environment.definition: Addressing disproportionate environmental burdens on minority and low-income communities.

energy_environment.name: Forest Management / Wildfire Prevention
energy_environment.definition: Policies for managing federal forests and reducing wildfire risk.

energy_environment.name: Natural Gas / Fracking
energy_environment.definition: Policies affecting natural gas extraction including hydraulic fracturing techniques.

energy_environment.name: Gulf Coast / Coastal Ecosystem Restoration
energy_environment.definition: Efforts to restore and protect Gulf Coast wetlands and ecosystems.

energy_environment.name: Chesapeake Bay / Regional Water Protection
energy_environment.definition: Programs to restore and protect the Chesapeake Bay and similar regional waterways.

healthcare.name: Affordable Care Act (ACA)
healthcare.definition: Policies implementing, modifying, or undermining the 2010 healthcare reform law.

healthcare.name: Medicaid
healthcare.definition: Policies affecting the federal-state health insurance program for low-income individuals.

healthcare.name: Medicare
healthcare.definition: Policies affecting the federal health insurance program for seniors and disabled individuals.

healthcare.name: Public Health Emergency Response
healthcare.definition: Federal coordination and resources for responding to health emergencies and outbreaks.

healthcare.name: Pandemic Preparedness
healthcare.definition: Planning and infrastructure to prepare for and respond to disease outbreaks.

healthcare.name: Quarantine / Communicable Disease Control
healthcare.definition: Federal authority to restrict movement and contain spread of infectious diseases.

healthcare.name: COVID-19 Response
healthcare.definition: Specific policies addressing the coronavirus pandemic including vaccines, mandates, and relief.

healthcare.name: Vaccine Policy
healthcare.definition: Policies affecting vaccine development, distribution, requirements, or exemptions.

healthcare.name: Prescription Drug Pricing
healthcare.definition: Efforts to reduce costs of medications through regulation or market reforms.

healthcare.name: Mental Health
healthcare.definition: Policies addressing mental health services, coverage, and awareness.

healthcare.name: Abortion / Reproductive Health
healthcare.definition: Policies affecting access to abortion services and reproductive healthcare.

healthcare.name: Healthcare Competition / Markets
healthcare.definition: Policies to increase transparency and competition in healthcare markets.

healthcare.name: Global Health Security
healthcare.definition: U.S. efforts to prevent and respond to international disease threats.

healthcare.name: Bioethics
healthcare.definition: Ethical guidelines for medical research, genetic engineering, and emerging biotechnologies.

healthcare.name: Veterans Healthcare
healthcare.definition: Policies affecting healthcare services provided through the VA system.

healthcare.name: Telehealth / Telemedicine
healthcare.definition: Policies enabling remote healthcare delivery through technology.

healthcare.name: Stem Cell / Biomedical Research
healthcare.definition: Policies governing federal funding and conduct of stem cell and medical research.

healthcare.name: Antibiotic Resistance
healthcare.definition: Efforts to combat drug-resistant bacteria and promote antibiotic stewardship.

healthcare.name: Kidney Health / Organ Donation
healthcare.definition: Policies to improve kidney care and increase organ donation rates.

healthcare.name: Contraception / Family Planning
healthcare.definition: Policies affecting access to birth control and family planning services.

healthcare.name: Newborn / Infant Care
healthcare.definition: Policies addressing healthcare and screening for newborns and infants.

civil_rights_equity.name: Racial Equity
civil_rights_equity.definition: Policies addressing systemic racial disparities and promoting equal outcomes across races.

civil_rights_equity.name: LGBTQ+ Rights
civil_rights_equity.definition: Policies affecting rights and protections for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer individuals.

civil_rights_equity.name: Gender Equality
civil_rights_equity.definition: Policies promoting equal treatment and opportunities regardless of gender.

civil_rights_equity.name: Disability Rights
civil_rights_equity.definition: Policies protecting rights and access for individuals with disabilities.

civil_rights_equity.name: Religious Liberty
civil_rights_equity.definition: Policies protecting freedom of religious practice and conscience rights.

civil_rights_equity.name: Free Speech
civil_rights_equity.definition: Policies affecting First Amendment protections for expression and assembly.

civil_rights_equity.name: Anti-discrimination
civil_rights_equity.definition: Policies prohibiting discrimination based on protected characteristics.

civil_rights_equity.name: Voting Rights
civil_rights_equity.definition: Policies affecting access to voting and election administration.

civil_rights_equity.name: Civil Rights Enforcement
civil_rights_equity.definition: Federal efforts to investigate and remedy civil rights violations.

civil_rights_equity.name: DEI (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion)
civil_rights_equity.definition: Policies promoting or restricting diversity programs in government and institutions.

civil_rights_equity.name: Affirmative Action
civil_rights_equity.definition: Policies requiring or prohibiting race-conscious measures in hiring or admissions.

civil_rights_equity.name: Anti-Semitism
civil_rights_equity.definition: Policies combating discrimination and hatred against Jewish people.

civil_rights_equity.name: Hate Crimes
civil_rights_equity.definition: Policies addressing crimes motivated by bias against protected groups.

civil_rights_equity.name: Pay Equity / Equal Pay
civil_rights_equity.definition: Policies addressing wage gaps based on gender, race, or other characteristics.

civil_rights_equity.name: Violence Against Women
civil_rights_equity.definition: Policies addressing domestic violence, sexual assault, and related crimes.

civil_rights_equity.name: International Religious Freedom
civil_rights_equity.definition: U.S. efforts to promote religious liberty and protect persecuted groups abroad.

education.name: K-12 Education Policy
education.definition: Federal policies affecting elementary and secondary education standards and funding.

education.name: School Choice / Vouchers
education.definition: Policies enabling public funding for private, charter, or religious schools.

education.name: Higher Education
education.definition: Policies affecting colleges, universities, and post-secondary education.

education.name: Curriculum Standards
education.definition: Federal involvement in what is taught in schools including history and civics.

education.name: Title IX
education.definition: Policies affecting sex-based discrimination protections in educational institutions.

education.name: STEM Education
education.definition: Initiatives promoting science, technology, engineering, and math education.

education.name: Apprenticeships / Vocational Training
education.definition: Programs providing job training as alternatives to traditional college education.

education.name: Student Loans / Financial Aid
education.definition: Policies affecting federal student loan programs, repayment, and forgiveness.

education.name: HBCUs
education.definition: Policies supporting Historically Black Colleges and Universities.

education.name: Education Freedom
education.definition: Policies expanding parental control over children's education choices.

education.name: Tribal Colleges / Native American Education
education.definition: Support for educational institutions serving Native American communities.

education.name: Educational Excellence Initiatives (by demographic)
education.definition: Targeted programs to improve educational outcomes for specific groups.

education.name: Campus Free Speech / Academic Freedom
education.definition: Policies protecting or regulating speech and viewpoint diversity at universities.

education.name: For-Profit Education / Veterans Education Protection
education.definition: Oversight of for-profit schools and protection of veterans using education benefits.

government_operations.name: Federal Workforce Management
government_operations.definition: Policies affecting hiring, compensation, and management of federal employees.

government_operations.name: Civil Service Reform
government_operations.definition: Changes to the merit-based system governing federal employment.

government_operations.name: Regulatory Reform / Deregulation
government_operations.definition: Efforts to reduce, streamline, or eliminate federal regulations.

government_operations.name: Government Efficiency
government_operations.definition: Initiatives to reduce waste, improve performance, and cut costs in government.

government_operations.name: Federal Hiring
government_operations.definition: Policies affecting how agencies recruit and hire federal employees.

government_operations.name: Schedule F / Political Appointments
government_operations.definition: Policies reclassifying federal positions to allow political appointment or removal.

government_operations.name: Ethics / Lobbying Rules
government_operations.definition: Standards governing conflicts of interest and post-government employment.

government_operations.name: Federal Spending
government_operations.definition: Executive policies directing or restricting agency expenditures.

government_operations.name: Government Reorganization
government_operations.definition: Restructuring of federal agencies, departments, or programs.

government_operations.name: Records / Classification / Transparency
government_operations.definition: Policies governing government records management and public access to information.

government_operations.name: FEMA / Emergency Management
government_operations.definition: Policies affecting federal disaster response and emergency preparedness.

government_operations.name: FOIA / Information Disclosure
government_operations.definition: Policies affecting public access to government records under Freedom of Information Act.

government_operations.name: Security Clearances / Background Investigations
government_operations.definition: Policies governing vetting of individuals for access to classified information.

government_operations.name: Presidential Records
government_operations.definition: Policies governing preservation and access to records of the presidency.

government_operations.name: Postal Service
government_operations.definition: Policies affecting operations and reform of the U.S. Postal Service.

government_operations.name: Faith-Based Initiatives
government_operations.definition: Policies enabling religious organizations to receive federal funding for services.

government_operations.name: Federal Labor-Management Relations
government_operations.definition: Policies governing collective bargaining and unions for federal employees.

foreign_policy.name: Diplomatic Relations
foreign_policy.definition: Establishment, modification, or severance of official relations with foreign nations.

foreign_policy.name: Foreign Aid
foreign_policy.definition: U.S. financial and material assistance to foreign countries and populations.

foreign_policy.name: International Agreements / Treaties
foreign_policy.definition: U.S. entry into, implementation of, or withdrawal from international agreements.

foreign_policy.name: United Nations Policy
foreign_policy.definition: U.S. engagement with and policy toward the United Nations system.

foreign_policy.name: WHO / International Health
foreign_policy.definition: U.S. participation in World Health Organization and global health initiatives.

foreign_policy.name: NATO
foreign_policy.definition: U.S. policy toward the North Atlantic Treaty Organization alliance.

foreign_policy.name: Sanctions (Country-Specific)
foreign_policy.definition: Economic and diplomatic penalties targeting specific foreign nations.

foreign_policy.name: Human Rights (International)
foreign_policy.definition: U.S. efforts to promote human rights standards and address abuses abroad.

foreign_policy.name: Global Engagement
foreign_policy.definition: Broad U.S. diplomatic and economic engagement with the international community.

foreign_policy.name: Africa Engagement / Trade
foreign_policy.definition: U.S. diplomatic and economic initiatives focused on African nations.

foreign_policy.name: Hostage Policy / Wrongfully Detained Citizens
foreign_policy.definition: Efforts to secure release of Americans held abroad.

foreign_policy.name: Diaspora Engagement
foreign_policy.definition: Outreach to immigrant communities with ties to their countries of origin.

foreign_policy.name: Global Development
foreign_policy.definition: U.S. efforts to promote economic development and reduce poverty worldwide.

country_region_specific.definition: Policies specifically addressing relations with or actions toward the People's Republic of China.

country_region_specific.definition: Policies affecting the broader Middle East region.

country_region_specific.name: Africa (General)
country_region_specific.definition: Policies affecting the African continent broadly.

country_region_specific.name: Europe (General)

country_region_specific.name: Asia-Pacific (General)
country_region_specific.definition: Policies affecting the Asia-Pacific region broadly.

country_region_specific.definition: Policies specifically addressing relations with or actions toward Syria.

country_region_specific.definition: Policies specifically addressing relations with or actions toward Burma/Myanmar.

country_region_specific.definition: Policies specifically addressing relations with or actions toward Belarus.

country_region_specific.definition: Policies specifically addressing relations with or actions toward Iraq.

country_region_specific.definition: Policies specifically addressing relations with or actions toward Afghanistan.

country_region_specific.definition: Policies addressing conflict diamonds and related issues in Sierra Leone.

country_region_specific.name: Ukraine / Crimea
country_region_specific.definition: Policies addressing Ukraine, Russian annexation of Crimea, and related conflict.

country_region_specific.name: Hong Kong
country_region_specific.definition: Policies addressing Hong Kong's autonomy and U.S. relations.

country_region_specific.name: Somalia
country_region_specific.definition: Policies specifically addressing relations with or actions toward Somalia.

country_region_specific.definition: Policies specifically addressing relations with or actions toward Yemen.

country_region_specific.definition: Policies specifically addressing relations with or actions toward Nicaragua.

country_region_specific.definition: Policies specifically addressing relations with or actions toward the Central African Republic.

country_region_specific.definition: Policies specifically addressing relations with or actions toward the DRC.

country_region_specific.name: Mali
country_region_specific.definition: Policies specifically addressing relations with or actions toward Mali.

law_enforcement_justice.name: Criminal Justice Reform
law_enforcement_justice.definition: Policies aimed at reforming sentencing, reducing incarceration, or improving fairness.

law_enforcement_justice.name: Federal Law Enforcement
law_enforcement_justice.definition: Policies affecting FBI, DEA, ATF, Marshals, and other federal law enforcement agencies.

law_enforcement_justice.name: State/Local Law Enforcement Support
law_enforcement_justice.definition: Federal assistance, equipment, and cooperation with state and local police.

law_enforcement_justice.name: Crime Reduction
law_enforcement_justice.definition: Policies aimed at reducing violent crime and improving public safety.

law_enforcement_justice.name: Prison Reform / Private Prisons
law_enforcement_justice.definition: Policies affecting conditions, operations, and use of private prisons in the federal system.

law_enforcement_justice.name: Drug Enforcement
law_enforcement_justice.definition: Policies targeting illegal drug manufacturing, trafficking, and distribution.

law_enforcement_justice.name: Opioid Crisis
law_enforcement_justice.definition: Policies specifically addressing the epidemic of opioid addiction and overdose deaths.

law_enforcement_justice.name: Human Trafficking
law_enforcement_justice.definition: Efforts to combat trafficking in persons for labor or sexual exploitation.

law_enforcement_justice.name: Transnational Crime / Cartels
law_enforcement_justice.definition: Policies targeting international criminal organizations and drug cartels.

law_enforcement_justice.name: Victim Rights
law_enforcement_justice.definition: Policies protecting and supporting victims of crime.

law_enforcement_justice.name: Police Reform
law_enforcement_justice.definition: Policies addressing use of force, accountability, and practices in policing.

law_enforcement_justice.name: Child Exploitation / Online Safety
law_enforcement_justice.definition: Efforts to combat child sexual abuse and protect children online.

law_enforcement_justice.name: Reentry / Recidivism Reduction
law_enforcement_justice.definition: Programs helping formerly incarcerated individuals successfully return to society.

law_enforcement_justice.name: Consumer Fraud / Market Integrity
law_enforcement_justice.definition: Enforcement against fraud, scams, and market manipulation affecting consumers.

technology_innovation.name: Artificial Intelligence
technology_innovation.definition: Policies governing development, use, and risks of AI technologies.

technology_innovation.name: Cybersecurity (Civilian)
technology_innovation.definition: Protecting private sector and civilian systems from cyber threats.

technology_innovation.name: Data Privacy
technology_innovation.definition: Policies protecting personal information and regulating data collection.

technology_innovation.name: Emerging Technologies
technology_innovation.definition: Policies addressing new technologies with significant potential impact.

technology_innovation.name: Tech Industry Regulation
technology_innovation.definition: Government oversight and rules affecting technology companies.

technology_innovation.name: Foreign Technology Threats
technology_innovation.definition: Policies addressing risks from foreign technology products and companies.

technology_innovation.name: Government IT Modernization
technology_innovation.definition: Upgrading federal technology systems and digital services.

technology_innovation.name: Space Policy
technology_innovation.definition: Policies governing space exploration, commercial space, and space security.

technology_innovation.name: Science and Technology Policy
technology_innovation.definition: Broad policies supporting scientific research and technological advancement.

technology_innovation.name: Social Media / Platform Policy
technology_innovation.definition: Policies addressing content moderation, censorship, and platform liability.

technology_innovation.name: Quantum Computing / Quantum Technology
technology_innovation.definition: Policies supporting development and security of quantum technologies.

technology_innovation.name: Biotechnology / Biomanufacturing
technology_innovation.definition: Policies supporting biological research and domestic biomanufacturing capacity.

technology_innovation.name: GPS / Positioning / Navigation Systems
technology_innovation.definition: Policies ensuring reliable positioning, navigation, and timing services.

technology_innovation.name: Telecommunications Security
technology_innovation.definition: Policies protecting communications infrastructure from foreign threats.

technology_innovation.name: E-Commerce / Online Trade Regulation
technology_innovation.definition: Policies governing online commerce, particularly cross-border transactions.

infrastructure.name: Transportation Infrastructure
infrastructure.definition: Policies affecting roads, bridges, rail, and other transportation systems.

infrastructure.name: Water Infrastructure
infrastructure.definition: Policies affecting water supply, treatment, and distribution systems.

infrastructure.name: Broadband / Telecommunications
infrastructure.definition: Policies expanding internet access and telecommunications networks.

infrastructure.name: Energy Infrastructure
infrastructure.definition: Policies affecting power generation, transmission, and distribution systems.

infrastructure.name: Infrastructure Permitting
infrastructure.definition: Policies streamlining or modifying approval processes for major projects.

infrastructure.name: Environmental Review Process
infrastructure.definition: Policies affecting NEPA reviews and environmental impact assessments.

infrastructure.name: Air Traffic / Aviation System
infrastructure.definition: Policies affecting airports, air traffic control, and aviation safety.

infrastructure.name: Port / Maritime Security
infrastructure.definition: Policies protecting ports and shipping from security threats.

infrastructure.name: Harbor / Waterfront Security
infrastructure.definition: Policies securing harbors and waterfront areas from threats.

labor_workforce.name: Worker Rights / Protections
labor_workforce.definition: Policies affecting wages, working conditions, and employee protections.

labor_workforce.name: Union Policy
labor_workforce.definition: Policies affecting labor union organizing, rights, and collective bargaining.

labor_workforce.name: Minimum Wage
labor_workforce.definition: Policies setting or raising minimum wage requirements.

labor_workforce.name: Workplace Safety (OSHA)
labor_workforce.definition: Policies affecting occupational health and safety standards.

labor_workforce.name: Employment Discrimination
labor_workforce.definition: Policies prohibiting discrimination in hiring and employment.

labor_workforce.name: Workforce Development
labor_workforce.definition: Programs training workers for available jobs and emerging industries.

labor_workforce.name: 21st Century Workforce / Skills
labor_workforce.definition: Initiatives preparing workers for modern economy skill requirements.

labor_workforce.name: Apprenticeships / Job Training
labor_workforce.definition: Programs providing on-the-job training and skill development.

labor_workforce.name: Project Labor Agreements
labor_workforce.definition: Policies requiring or prohibiting union agreements on federal construction projects.

labor_workforce.name: Retirement Security
labor_workforce.definition: Policies affecting pensions, 401(k)s, and retirement savings.

labor_workforce.name: Caregiving / Paid Leave
labor_workforce.definition: Policies supporting family leave, caregiving, and work-life balance.

labor_workforce.name: Forced Labor / Labor Standards (International)
labor_workforce.definition: Policies prohibiting imports made with forced labor and promoting global labor standards.

agriculture_rural.name: Agricultural Policy
agriculture_rural.definition: Policies affecting farming, crop production, and agricultural markets.

agriculture_rural.name: Rural Development
agriculture_rural.definition: Investments and programs supporting economic growth in rural areas.

agriculture_rural.name: Food Security / Nutrition
agriculture_rural.definition: Policies ensuring access to adequate food and nutrition programs.

agriculture_rural.name: Farming / Ranching
agriculture_rural.definition: Policies specifically affecting farm and ranch operations.

agriculture_rural.name: Agricultural Biotechnology
agriculture_rural.definition: Policies governing genetically modified crops and agricultural innovation.

agriculture_rural.name: Rural Healthcare / Telehealth
agriculture_rural.definition: Expanding healthcare access in rural and underserved areas.

agriculture_rural.name: Rural Broadband
agriculture_rural.definition: Expanding internet access to rural communities.

agriculture_rural.name: Food Supply Chain
agriculture_rural.definition: Policies ensuring resilience and security of food production and distribution.

disaster_emergency.name: Disaster Response
disaster_emergency.definition: Federal coordination and resources for responding to natural disasters.

disaster_emergency.name: Emergency Declarations
disaster_emergency.definition: Presidential declarations unlocking federal resources and authorities for emergencies.

disaster_emergency.name: Wildfire Management
disaster_emergency.definition: Policies for preventing, fighting, and recovering from wildfires.

disaster_emergency.name: Flood Management
disaster_emergency.definition: Policies for flood prevention, insurance, and recovery.

disaster_emergency.name: National Emergencies
disaster_emergency.definition: Declaration and use of emergency powers under the National Emergencies Act.

disaster_emergency.name: Hurricane Recovery (Katrina, etc.)
disaster_emergency.definition: Federal response and rebuilding efforts following major hurricanes.

disaster_emergency.name: Disaster Rebuilding / Long-term Recovery
disaster_emergency.definition: Policies supporting communities in long-term recovery from disasters.

disaster_emergency.name: Citizen Preparedness
disaster_emergency.definition: Programs encouraging individual and community emergency preparedness.

administrative_procedural.name: Revocation of Previous Executive Orders
administrative_procedural.definition: Orders canceling or reversing previous executive actions.

administrative_procedural.name: Delegation of Authority
administrative_procedural.definition: Assignment of presidential powers to agency heads or officials.

administrative_procedural.name: Federal Advisory Committees
administrative_procedural.definition: Creation or management of committees providing advice to the executive branch.

administrative_procedural.name: Order of Succession
administrative_procedural.definition: Establishing lines of succession for agency leadership.

administrative_procedural.name: Presidential Commissions / Task Forces
administrative_procedural.definition: Creation of bodies to study issues and make recommendations.

administrative_procedural.name: Interagency Coordination
administrative_procedural.definition: Policies improving cooperation and communication between federal agencies.

social_cultural.name: American Heritage / Patriotism
social_cultural.definition: Policies promoting American history, values, and national identity.

social_cultural.name: Historical Commemorations
social_cultural.definition: Recognition of historical events, figures, and anniversaries.

social_cultural.name: National Monuments / Memorials
social_cultural.definition: Designation and management of monuments honoring historical significance.

social_cultural.name: Arts and Humanities
social_cultural.definition: Federal support for cultural institutions and creative endeavors.

social_cultural.name: Volunteerism / National Service
social_cultural.definition: Programs encouraging volunteer service and civic engagement.

social_cultural.name: Civic Participation
social_cultural.definition: Policies promoting citizen engagement in democratic processes.

social_cultural.name: Physical Fitness / Health Promotion
social_cultural.definition: Initiatives promoting exercise, nutrition, and healthy lifestyles.

social_cultural.name: Youth Programs
social_cultural.definition: Federal initiatives supporting young people's development and opportunities.

social_cultural.name: Child Welfare / Foster Care
social_cultural.definition: Policies affecting child protection services and foster care systems.

social_cultural.name: Museums / Libraries / Cultural Institutions
social_cultural.definition: Federal support for cultural and educational institutions.

social_cultural.name: 1776 Commission / Patriotic Education
social_cultural.definition: Initiatives promoting traditional or patriotic approaches to history education.

international_institutions.name: United Nations
international_institutions.definition: U.S. policy toward and participation in the United Nations.

international_institutions.name: World Health Organization (WHO)
international_institutions.definition: U.S. engagement with or withdrawal from the WHO.

international_institutions.name: International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA)
international_institutions.definition: U.S. cooperation with nuclear monitoring and non-proliferation efforts.

international_institutions.name: NATO
international_institutions.definition: U.S. commitments to and policy within the North Atlantic alliance.

international_institutions.name: World Trade Organization (WTO)
international_institutions.definition: U.S. policy toward global trade rules and dispute resolution.

international_institutions.name: African Union
international_institutions.definition: U.S. engagement with the continental African organization.

international_institutions.name: International Criminal Court
international_institutions.definition: U.S. policy toward the ICC, including sanctions or cooperation.

international_institutions.name: Paris Climate Agreement
international_institutions.definition: U.S. participation in or withdrawal from the international climate accord.

international_institutions.name: International Monetary Fund / World Bank
international_institutions.definition: U.S. policy toward international financial institutions.

racial_ethnic.name: African Americans / Black Americans
racial_ethnic.definition: Americans of African descent, including those whose ancestors were enslaved.

racial_ethnic.name: Hispanic / Latino Americans
racial_ethnic.definition: Americans with origins in Spanish-speaking countries of Latin America or Spain.

racial_ethnic.name: Asian Americans
racial_ethnic.definition: Americans with origins in East Asia, Southeast Asia, or South Asia.

racial_ethnic.name: Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islanders
racial_ethnic.definition: Americans with origins in Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific islands.

racial_ethnic.name: Native Americans / Indigenous Peoples
racial_ethnic.definition: Members of federally recognized tribes and indigenous peoples of the continental U.S.

racial_ethnic.name: Alaska Natives
racial_ethnic.definition: Indigenous peoples of Alaska including Inuit, Yupik, and Aleut communities.

racial_ethnic.name: Multiracial Americans
racial_ethnic.definition: Americans who identify with two or more racial backgrounds.

gender_identity_sexuality.name: Women
gender_identity_sexuality.definition: Female-identifying individuals, often specifically addressed in policies on equity and healthcare.

gender_identity_sexuality.name: LGBTQ+ Individuals
gender_identity_sexuality.definition: Lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, and other sexual and gender minorities.

gender_identity_sexuality.name: Transgender Individuals
gender_identity_sexuality.definition: Individuals whose gender identity differs from their sex assigned at birth.

gender_identity_sexuality.name: Non-binary Individuals
gender_identity_sexuality.definition: Individuals who identify outside the traditional male/female gender binary.

age_groups.name: Youth / Young Adults
age_groups.definition: Individuals typically ages 16-24, often targeted by education and workforce programs.

age_groups.name: Working-Age Adults
age_groups.definition: Adults in their primary working years, typically ages 25-64.

age_groups.name: Seniors / Elderly
age_groups.definition: Older adults, typically 65 and over, often addressed in healthcare and retirement policies.

religious_groups.name: Christians
religious_groups.definition: Adherents of Christianity in its various denominations.

religious_groups.name: Jews / Jewish Americans
religious_groups.definition: Adherents of Judaism and those of Jewish ethnic heritage.

religious_groups.name: Religious Organizations
religious_groups.definition: Churches, mosques, synagogues, and other religious institutions.

religious_groups.name: Faith-Based Communities
religious_groups.definition: Communities organized around shared religious beliefs and practices.

religious_groups.name: Secular / Non-religious
religious_groups.definition: Individuals who do not identify with any religion, including atheists and agnostics.

disability_status.name: Individuals with Disabilities
disability_status.definition: People with physical, sensory, cognitive, or developmental disabilities.

disability_status.name: Individuals with Mental Health Conditions
disability_status.definition: People living with mental illness or psychological conditions.

disability_status.name: Individuals with Chronic Illnesses
disability_status.definition: People living with ongoing health conditions requiring long-term management.

immigration_status.name: U.S. Citizens
immigration_status.definition: Individuals holding U.S. citizenship by birth or naturalization.

immigration_status.name: Lawful Permanent Residents (Green Card Holders)
immigration_status.definition: Non-citizens authorized to live and work permanently in the U.S.

immigration_status.name: Visa Holders (Work, Student, Tourist)
immigration_status.definition: Non-citizens in the U.S. on temporary visas for specific purposes.

immigration_status.name: Undocumented Immigrants
immigration_status.definition: Individuals residing in the U.S. without legal immigration status.

immigration_status.name: Asylum Seekers
immigration_status.definition: Individuals who have applied for protection from persecution in their home country.

immigration_status.name: Refugees
immigration_status.definition: Individuals admitted to the U.S. after fleeing persecution abroad.

immigration_status.name: DACA Recipients / Dreamers
immigration_status.definition: Individuals brought to the U.S. as children who received deferred deportation status.

immigration_status.name: TPS (Temporary Protected Status) Holders
immigration_status.definition: Individuals from designated countries granted temporary protection from deportation.

immigration_status.name: Naturalized Citizens
immigration_status.definition: Foreign-born individuals who have completed the citizenship process.

immigration_status.name: Birthright Citizens
immigration_status.definition: Individuals who are citizens by virtue of being born in the U.S.

immigration_status.name: Noncitizens Serving in Armed Forces
immigration_status.definition: Non-citizens who serve in the U.S. military.

government.name: Federal Employees / Civil Servants
government.definition: Civilian employees of the federal government across all agencies.

government.name: Federal Contractors
government.definition: Private sector workers employed on federal contracts.

government.name: Military Personnel (Active Duty)
government.definition: Full-time members of the U.S. armed forces.

government.name: Military Personnel (Reserves/Guard)
government.definition: Part-time military members in Reserve or National Guard units.

government.name: Military Reservists Called to Active Duty
government.definition: Reserve members activated for full-time military service.

government.name: Military Spouses
government.definition: Spouses of active duty or veteran military members.

government.name: Veterans
government.definition: Former members of the U.S. armed forces.

government.name: Intelligence Community Personnel
government.definition: Employees of CIA, NSA, and other intelligence agencies.

government.name: Law Enforcement Officers (Federal)
government.definition: Officers in FBI, DEA, ATF, Marshals, and other federal law enforcement.

government.name: Law Enforcement Officers (State/Local)
government.definition: Police officers and sheriffs employed by state and local governments.

government.name: Postal Workers
government.definition: Employees of the U.S. Postal Service.

government.name: Foreign Service Officers
government.definition: Diplomats representing the U.S. abroad through the State Department.

government.name: Political Appointees
government.definition: Officials appointed by the President to serve in executive branch positions.

government.name: Security Clearance Holders
government.definition: Individuals authorized to access classified government information.

private_sector.name: Small Business Owners
private_sector.definition: Owners of businesses with fewer than 500 employees.

private_sector.name: Entrepreneurs / Startups
private_sector.definition: Founders and employees of new business ventures.

private_sector.name: Gig Economy Workers
private_sector.definition: Workers in app-based and on-demand service jobs.

private_sector.name: Independent Contractors
private_sector.definition: Self-employed individuals providing services to businesses.

private_sector.name: Union Members
private_sector.definition: Workers represented by labor unions for collective bargaining.

private_sector.name: Non-union Workers
private_sector.definition: Private sector workers not represented by unions.

private_sector.name: Corporate Executives / Officers
private_sector.definition: Senior leadership of corporations including CEOs and board members.

industry_specific.name: Healthcare Workers
industry_specific.definition: Doctors, nurses, and other medical professionals.

industry_specific.name: Teachers / Educators
industry_specific.definition: K-12 teachers, professors, and educational staff.

industry_specific.name: Agricultural Workers / Farmers
industry_specific.definition: Farm owners, farm workers, and agricultural laborers.

industry_specific.name: Manufacturing Workers
industry_specific.definition: Workers in factories and production facilities.

industry_specific.name: Technology Workers
industry_specific.definition: Software developers, engineers, and tech industry employees.

industry_specific.name: Energy Sector Workers (Oil, Gas, Coal)
industry_specific.definition: Workers in fossil fuel extraction and production.

industry_specific.name: Renewable Energy Workers
industry_specific.definition: Workers in solar, wind, and other clean energy industries.

industry_specific.name: Construction Workers
industry_specific.definition: Workers in building and infrastructure construction.

industry_specific.name: Transportation Workers
industry_specific.definition: Truck drivers, rail workers, and transit employees.

industry_specific.name: Financial Services Workers
industry_specific.definition: Bank employees, investment professionals, and insurance workers.

industry_specific.name: Retail Workers
industry_specific.definition: Employees in stores and retail establishments.

industry_specific.name: Hospitality Workers
industry_specific.definition: Hotel, restaurant, and tourism industry employees.

industry_specific.name: Scientific Researchers
industry_specific.definition: Scientists and researchers in academic and private institutions.

industry_specific.name: Journalists / Media Professionals
industry_specific.definition: Reporters, editors, and media industry workers.

industry_specific.name: Maritime / Port Workers
industry_specific.definition: Workers at ports and in shipping industries.

industry_specific.name: Airline / Aviation Workers
industry_specific.definition: Pilots, flight attendants, and airport workers.

industry_specific.name: Defense Industry Workers
industry_specific.definition: Employees of defense contractors and weapons manufacturers.

industry_specific.name: Seafood / Fishery Workers
industry_specific.definition: Commercial fishers and seafood processing workers.

industry_specific.name: Merchant Marine Workers
industry_specific.definition: Civilian mariners on U.S.-flagged commercial vessels.

industry_specific.name: Cybersecurity Professionals
industry_specific.definition: Specialists in protecting computer systems and networks.

industry_specific.name: Automotive Industry Workers
industry_specific.definition: Workers in car manufacturing and auto parts production.

economic_status.name: Low-Income Individuals / Families
economic_status.definition: Households earning below median income, often eligible for assistance programs.

economic_status.name: Middle-Class Americans
economic_status.definition: Households with moderate income, typically between poverty and upper-income thresholds.

economic_status.name: High-Income / Wealthy Individuals
economic_status.definition: Households with income significantly above median, often affected by tax policies.

economic_status.name: Individuals Experiencing Poverty
economic_status.definition: People living below the federal poverty line.

economic_status.name: Food Insecure Populations
economic_status.definition: Individuals and families with uncertain access to adequate food.

domestic.name: Urban Communities
domestic.definition: Residents of cities and metropolitan areas.

domestic.name: Suburban Communities
domestic.definition: Residents of areas surrounding major cities.

domestic.name: Rural Communities
domestic.definition: Residents of small towns and agricultural areas.

domestic.name: Tribal Communities / Reservations
domestic.definition: Native American communities living on tribal lands.

domestic.name: Border Communities
domestic.definition: Communities along the U.S.-Mexico and U.S.-Canada borders.

domestic.name: Coastal Communities
domestic.definition: Communities along ocean coasts, affected by maritime and environmental policies.

domestic.name: Disaster-Affected Communities
domestic.definition: Areas impacted by hurricanes, floods, wildfires, or other disasters.

regional.name: Alaska Residents
regional.definition: Residents of the state of Alaska, with unique geographic and policy considerations.

regional.name: Hawaii Residents
regional.definition: Residents of the state of Hawaii.

regional.name: Puerto Rico Residents
regional.definition: U.S. citizens living in the territory of Puerto Rico.

regional.name: U.S. Territory Residents
regional.definition: Residents of Guam, U.S. Virgin Islands, American Samoa, and other territories.

regional.name: Specific State Populations
regional.definition: Residents of particular states affected by state-specific federal policies.

education.name: K-12 Students
education.definition: Students in elementary, middle, and high school.

education.name: College / University Students
education.definition: Students pursuing undergraduate degrees.

education.name: Graduate / Professional Students
education.definition: Students in master's, doctoral, or professional degree programs.

education.name: Homeschool Families
education.definition: Families educating children at home rather than in traditional schools.

education.name: Charter School Communities
education.definition: Students, parents, and staff at publicly-funded charter schools.

education.name: Private School Communities
education.definition: Students, parents, and staff at private educational institutions.

education.name: Public School Communities
education.definition: Students, parents, and staff at traditional public schools.

education.name: HBCU Students / Communities
education.definition: Students and communities at Historically Black Colleges and Universities.

education.name: Tribal College Students / Communities
education.definition: Students at colleges serving Native American communities.

education.name: International Students
education.definition: Foreign nationals studying at U.S. educational institutions.

education.name: Special Education Students / Families
education.definition: Students with disabilities receiving specialized educational services.

healthcare.name: Medicare Beneficiaries
healthcare.definition: Seniors and disabled individuals receiving Medicare coverage.

healthcare.name: Medicaid Beneficiaries
healthcare.definition: Low-income individuals receiving Medicaid coverage.

healthcare.name: ACA / Marketplace Enrollees
healthcare.definition: Individuals with health insurance through ACA exchanges.

healthcare.name: Uninsured Individuals
healthcare.definition: People lacking health insurance coverage.

healthcare.name: Patients (General)
healthcare.definition: Individuals receiving or seeking healthcare services.

healthcare.name: Social Security Beneficiaries
healthcare.definition: Individuals receiving Social Security retirement or disability benefits.

justice_system.name: Incarcerated Individuals
justice_system.definition: People currently in prison or jail.

justice_system.name: Formerly Incarcerated / Returning Citizens
justice_system.definition: People who have been released from prison and are reintegrating into society.

justice_system.name: Individuals on Probation/Parole
justice_system.definition: People under community supervision as part of their sentence.

justice_system.name: Crime Victims
justice_system.definition: Individuals who have suffered harm from criminal acts.

justice_system.name: Defendants / Accused Persons
justice_system.definition: Individuals facing criminal charges in the justice system.

special_populations.name: Whistleblowers
special_populations.definition: Individuals who report illegal or unethical activities within organizations.

special_populations.name: Human Trafficking Victims
special_populations.definition: Individuals exploited through forced labor or sex trafficking.

special_populations.name: Domestic Violence Survivors
special_populations.definition: Individuals who have experienced intimate partner violence.

special_populations.name: Taxpayers
special_populations.definition: Individuals and entities paying federal taxes.

special_populations.name: Consumers
special_populations.definition: The general public as purchasers of goods and services.

special_populations.name: Investors
special_populations.definition: Individuals with money in stocks, bonds, or other financial instruments.

special_populations.name: Cryptocurrency / Digital Asset Holders
special_populations.definition: Individuals owning Bitcoin, other cryptocurrencies, or digital assets.

special_populations.name: Gun Owners / Second Amendment Advocates
special_populations.definition: Individuals who own firearms or advocate for gun rights.

special_populations.name: Environmental Justice Communities
special_populations.definition: Communities disproportionately affected by pollution and environmental hazards.

special_populations.name: Volunteers / National Service Participants
special_populations.definition: Individuals serving in AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, or other service programs.

special_populations.name: Detainees / Prisoners of War
special_populations.definition: Individuals held in military or national security detention.

special_populations.name: Renters / Homeowners
special_populations.definition: Individuals in the housing market as tenants or property owners.

special_populations.name: Caregivers (Non-military)
special_populations.definition: Individuals providing unpaid care to family members or others.

special_populations.name: Military Caregivers
special_populations.definition: Individuals caring for wounded, ill, or injured service members or veterans.

special_populations.name: Opportunity Zone Residents
special_populations.definition: Residents of designated low-income areas eligible for investment incentives.

special_populations.name: Hostages / Wrongfully Detained Americans Abroad
special_populations.definition: U.S. citizens held captive or detained overseas.

special_populations.name: Child Exploitation Victims
special_populations.definition: Children who have been sexually abused or exploited.

special_populations.name: Missing / Murdered Indigenous Persons
special_populations.definition: Native American and Alaska Native individuals who are missing or have been killed.

foreign_populations.name: Foreign Nationals (General)
foreign_populations.definition: Individuals who are citizens of countries other than the United States.

foreign_populations.name: Foreign Government Officials
foreign_populations.definition: Officials of foreign governments, often subject to sanctions or diplomatic immunity.

foreign_populations.name: Citizens of Specific Countries (by EO designation)
foreign_populations.definition: Nationals of countries specifically named in executive orders for restrictions or sanctions.

foreign_populations.name: International Aid Recipients
foreign_populations.definition: Foreign individuals and communities receiving U.S. foreign assistance.

foreign_populations.name: Global Health Populations
foreign_populations.definition: Foreign populations affected by U.S. global health programs and initiatives.

organizational_entities.name: Corporations / Businesses
organizational_entities.definition: For-profit business entities of all sizes.

organizational_entities.name: Nonprofit Organizations
organizational_entities.definition: Tax-exempt organizations serving charitable, educational, or social purposes.

organizational_entities.name: Religious Institutions
organizational_entities.definition: Churches, mosques, synagogues, and other houses of worship.

organizational_entities.name: Labor Unions
organizational_entities.definition: Organizations representing workers in collective bargaining.

organizational_entities.name: State Governments
organizational_entities.definition: The governments of the 50 U.S. states.

organizational_entities.name: Tribal Governments
organizational_entities.definition: Sovereign governments of federally recognized Native American tribes.

organizational_entities.name: International Organizations
organizational_entities.definition: Multilateral bodies like the UN, WHO, NATO, and others.

metadata.notes: Designed for neutral, comprehensive tagging of executive orders regardless of political perspective. Impact types simplified to positive/negative/neutral for clearer classification.

themes.name: Digital Government / Customer Experience
themes.eo_title: Transforming Federal Customer Experience and Service Delivery To Rebuild Trust in Government
themes.justification: The order focuses extensively on improving federal customer experience and service delivery through human-centered digital design and modernization, which is broader than but related to government IT modernization.

themes.name: Native American / Tribal Affairs
themes.eo_title: Reforming Federal Funding and Support for Tribal Nations To Better Embrace Our Trust Responsibilities and Promote the Next Era of Tribal Self-Determination
themes.justification: The order specifically focuses on Tribal Nations, their sovereignty, and federal funding/support tailored to them, which is not explicitly covered by current themes.

themes.name: Puerto Rico Policy
themes.justification: Puerto Rico is a U.S. territory with unique federal considerations, and no existing taxonomy theme specifically addresses territorial policy distinct from states or foreign countries.

themes.name: poverty-reduction
themes.eo_title: Reducing Poverty in America by Promoting Opportunity and Economic Mobility
themes.justification: The executive order centers on reducing poverty and promoting economic mobility, which is not explicitly covered by any existing theme; adding a specific poverty reduction theme would improve thematic accuracy.

themes.name: tourism
themes.eo_title: Making America Beautiful Again by Improving Our National Parks
themes.justification: The order focuses significantly on increasing international tourism to national parks and adjusting fees for foreign visitors, which is a tourism policy area not explicitly covered in the existing taxonomy.

impacted_populations.name: Importers / Exporters
impacted_populations.eo_title: Modifying the Scope of the Reciprocal Tariffs With Respect to Certain Agricultural Products
impacted_populations.justification: This order directly affects entities involved in importing/exporting affected agricultural products, who are not explicitly captured in existing taxonomy categories.

impacted_populations.name: Opioid Crisis Patients
impacted_populations.eo_title: Modifying Duties Addressing the Synthetic Opioid Supply Chain in the People's Republic of China
impacted_populations.justification: This executive order directly targets the supply of synthetic opioids, which directly impacts individuals struggling with opioid addiction and those affected by overdose.

impacted_populations.name: People Who Inject Drugs
impacted_populations.eo_title: Implementing the National HIV/AIDS Strategy for the United States for 2015-2020
impacted_populations.justification: This group is specifically named in the order as experiencing disparities and at heightened HIV risk but is not included in the existing taxonomy.

impacted_populations.name: Southern U.S. Residents
impacted_populations.eo_title: Implementing the National HIV/AIDS Strategy for the United States for 2015-2020
impacted_populations.justification: The order specifically cites people living in the Southern United States as a priority population with elevated HIV burden.

impacted_populations.name: Foreign Financial Institutions
impacted_populations.eo_title: Taking Additional Steps With Respect to the Russian Federation's Harmful Activities
impacted_populations.justification: The EO targets foreign financial institutions directly by sanctioning them, but the taxonomy lacks a dedicated category for these entities.

impacted_populations.name: National Security Personnel
impacted_populations.eo_title: Ensuring Continued Accountability in Federal Hiring
impacted_populations.justification: The EO explicitly prioritizes hiring and staffing related to national security, but no exact taxonomy population currently captures national security personnel.

impacted_populations.name: Venezuelan Civilians
impacted_populations.eo_title: Imposing Additional Sanctions With Respect to the Situation in Venezuela
impacted_populations.justification: The executive order targets Venezuela's government institutionally but indirectly impacts general Venezuelan civilians through economic sanctions and humanitarian crises, which is not specifically captured by existing taxonomy categories.

impacted_populations.name: parents
impacted_populations.eo_title: Establishing the President's Advisory 1776 Commission
impacted_populations.justification: Parents as a distinct group deeply involved in and affected by local curriculum control and patriotic education are not explicitly included, yet they have meaningful influence and experience impact.

impacted_populations.name: importers
impacted_populations.eo_title: Addressing Threats to the United States by the Government of the Russian Federation
impacted_populations.justification: Importers are directly and meaningfully affected by tariffs and trade policy changes, however this group is not specifically listed in the taxonomy; including them would clarify direct impacts on those dealing with affected goods.

impacted_populations.name: miners
impacted_populations.eo_title: Addressing the Threat to the Domestic Supply Chain From Reliance on Critical Minerals From Foreign Adversaries and Supporting the Domestic Mining and Processing Industries
impacted_populations.justification: Miners are directly impacted by policies expanding domestic mining capacity but there is no specific existing population category explicitly for miners distinct from general manufacturing or energy sector workers.

impacted_populations.name: Individuals with Pre-Existing Conditions
impacted_populations.eo_title: An America-First Healthcare Plan
impacted_populations.justification: The EO refers extensively to protections and improved access for individuals with pre-existing conditions, yet this specific population is not listed in the taxonomy; adding it would capture a key affected group distinct from broader chronic illnesses.

impacted_populations.name: importers-exporters
impacted_populations.eo_title: Prohibiting Certain Imports, Exports, and New Investment With Respect to Continued Russian Federation Aggression
impacted_populations.justification: This order directly restricts certain imports and exports, impacting importers and exporters specifically, but these actors are not explicitly categorized in the existing taxonomy.

impacted_populations.name: data-brokerage-industry
impacted_populations.eo_title: Preventing Access to Americans' Bulk Sensitive Personal Data and United States Government-Related Data by Countries of Concern
impacted_populations.justification: The executive order specifically calls out data brokerage entities as unique risks for enabling access to Americans' sensitive data by countries of concern. The existing taxonomy lacks a discrete industry group for data brokers, distinct from corporations broadly, and their direct impact is significant.

impacted_populations.name: Importers
impacted_populations.eo_title: Extending the Modification of the Reciprocal Tariff Rates
impacted_populations.justification: Importers are directly affected by tariff changes but are not explicitly listed in the taxonomy; they bear increased costs and compliance burdens related to tariffs.

impacted_populations.name: importers-exporters
impacted_populations.eo_title: Modifying Reciprocal Tariff Rates To Reflect Trading Partner Retaliation and Alignment
impacted_populations.justification: This order directly affects importers and exporters involved in trade with China and other listed countries by altering tariff rates, impacting their costs and operations, yet this population is not listed in the existing taxonomy.

impacted_populations.name: import-dependent-retail-workers
impacted_populations.eo_title: Regulating Imports With a Reciprocal Tariff To Rectify Trade Practices That Contribute to Large and Persistent Annual United States Goods Trade Deficits
impacted_populations.justification: Workers employed in retail sectors that rely heavily on imported goods may face job or wage impacts due to increased tariffs and higher import costs, but such a population is not explicitly covered in the existing taxonomy.

impacted_populations.name: individuals-without-banking-access
impacted_populations.eo_title: Modernizing Payments To and From America's Bank Account
impacted_populations.justification: The order explicitly exempts those without access to banking or electronic payments, but the existing taxonomy does not have a precise population to capture unbanked individuals who are directly impacted.

impacted_populations.name: tourists
impacted_populations.eo_title: Establishing the White House Task Force on the FIFA World Cup 2026
impacted_populations.justification: Tourists are a distinct group directly impacted by the event through travel, lodging, and services, but the taxonomy lacks a clear category for tourists who are directly affected economically and infrastructure-wise.

impacted_populations.name: importers-exporters
impacted_populations.eo_title: Amendment to Duties To Address the Flow of Illicit Drugs Across Our Northern Border
impacted_populations.justification: This order modifies tariff and duty policies that directly impact entities engaged in cross-border trade, a group not explicitly listed in the existing taxonomy.

impacted_populations.name: consumers
impacted_populations.eo_title: Amendment to Duties To Address the Flow of Illicit Drugs Across Our Northern Border
impacted_populations.justification: Consumers may face higher prices or reduced availability of goods due to the modified tariff/duty regime affecting trade across the northern border.

impacted_populations.name: limited-english-proficiency-individuals
impacted_populations.eo_title: Designating English as the Official Language of the United States
impacted_populations.justification: This group includes individuals who struggle with English proficiency and are directly affected by reduction or potential barriers in multilingual government services; the current taxonomy does not isolate this population specifically.

impacted_populations.name: miners-smelters-refiners
impacted_populations.eo_title: Addressing the Threat to National Security From Imports of Copper
impacted_populations.justification: This population includes workers directly involved in copper mining, smelting, and refining processes, critical to implementing the order's goal of expanding domestic capacity; currently missing as a discrete category.

impacted_populations.name: Afrikaners in South Africa
impacted_populations.eo_title: Addressing Egregious Actions of the Republic of South Africa
impacted_populations.justification: Afrikaners as a distinct ethnic minority group specifically targeted by the EO are not explicitly listed in the taxonomy; tagging them separately would clarify their direct positive and negative impacts beyond general 'foreign nationals' or 'citizens of specific countries.'

impacted_populations.name: Israeli Citizens
impacted_populations.eo_title: Withdrawing the United States From and Ending Funding to Certain United Nations Organizations and Reviewing United States Support to All International Organizations
impacted_populations.justification: The Executive Order explicitly references protecting US allies including Israel and condemns anti-Israel sentiment, thus Israeli citizens directly benefit, yet this group is not present in the nominal taxonomy.

impacted_populations.name: Arab Palestinian Populations
impacted_populations.eo_title: Withdrawing the United States From and Ending Funding to Certain United Nations Organizations and Reviewing United States Support to All International Organizations
impacted_populations.justification: Because the order explicitly targets UNRWA and its funding for Palestinian refugees, this population will be negatively and directly impacted due to cuts in humanitarian aid; this specific group is missing from the taxonomy.

impacted_populations.name: parents
impacted_populations.eo_title: Ending Radical Indoctrination in K-12 Schooling
impacted_populations.justification: Parents are central to this EO since it emphasizes protecting parental rights over K-12 education and student information; yet 'parents' as a population is not part of the current taxonomy.
